data.name: Tropius
data.flavorText: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.

attacks.name: Rally Back
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Petilil
data.flavorText: They prefer clean water and soil. When the environment they live in turns bad, the whole bunch will up and move to a new area.

data.name: Trevenant V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Claw
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Leafeon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Greening Cells
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Lotad
data.flavorText: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.

data.name: Feebas
data.flavorText: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Victini
data.flavorText: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

attacks.name: Victory Dive
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Galarian Articuno
data.flavorText: Known as Articuno, this Pokémon fires beams that can immobilize opponents as if they had been frozen solid.

abilities.name: Cruel Charge
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Psychic Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psylaser
attacks.text: Discard all Psychic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Regieleki
data.flavorText: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar's electricity.

attacks.name: Teraspark
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack also does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.

attacks.name: Go and Collect
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

attacks.name: Clean Hit
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Bullet Straight Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Umbreon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mean Look
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Moonlight Blade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Lycanroc VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hunting Claw
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has 60 HP or less remaining.

attacks.name: Max Edge
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Nuzleaf
data.flavorText: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf's grass flute fills listeners with dread.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Galarian Moltres
data.flavorText: The sinister aura that blazes like molten fire around this Pokémon is what inspired the name Moltres.

abilities.name: Malevolent Charge
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Darkness Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fiery Wrath
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Nickit
data.flavorText: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

data.name: Bagon
data.flavorText: Some theories suggest that its behavior of forcefully bashing its head into things stimulates cells that affect its evolution.

data.name: Salamence
data.flavorText: Thanks to its fervent wishes, the cells in its body finally mutated, and at last it has its heart's desire—wings.

abilities.name: Intimidating Roar
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fierce Dragon
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Deino
data.flavorText: Because it can't see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Rayquaza V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Spiral Burst
attacks.text: You may discard up to 2 basic Fire Energy or up to 2 basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Noivern V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Boomburst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Synchro Loud
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Zweilous
data.flavorText: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.

data.name: Duraludon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Skyscraper
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have Special Energy attached.

attacks.name: G-Max Pulverization
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Smeargle
data.flavorText: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

attacks.name: Live Painting
attacks.text: Reveal any number of basic Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 30 more damage for each type of basic Energy you revealed in this way.

data.name: Teddiursa
data.flavorText: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.

data.name: Slaking
data.flavorText: It is the world's most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.

abilities.name: Act Freely
abilities.text: If a Stadium is in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Rout
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Fletchling
data.flavorText: Its body is always warm. Trainers who live in cold areas apparently sleep with it in their bed.

attacks.name: Tailwind Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you go second and it's your first turn, draw 3 more cards.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Gordie
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal any number of Energy cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Zinnia's Resolve
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand. Draw a card for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Stormy Mountains
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for a Basic Lightning Pokémon or Basic Dragon Pokémon and put it onto their Bench. Then, that player shuffles their deck.

data.name: Toy Catcher
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has 50 HP or less remaining with your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Flareon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flaming Breath
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Scorching Column
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Glaceon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frozen Awakening
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Heavy Snow
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Medicham V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Yoga Loop
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, take another turn after this one. (Skip Pokémon Checkup.) If 1 of your Pokémon used Yoga Loop during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

attacks.name: Smash Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Lycanroc V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crashing Fangs
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Garbodor V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Trash Stench
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Dragonite V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Gale
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Aroma Lady
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you do, your Active Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Copycat
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each card in your opponent's hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Jumpluff
data.flavorText: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.

abilities.name: Fluffy Barrage
abilities.text: This Pokémon may attack twice each turn. If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.

data.name: Pinsir
data.flavorText: Although it's tough, it can't handle cold well. When night falls, it buries itself in leafage and sleeps.

abilities.name: Vise Coach
abilities.text: Damage from your Single Strike Pokémon's attacks isn't affected by your opponent's Active Pokémon's Resistance.

data.name: Dwebble
data.flavorText: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Bergmite
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.

data.name: Dracozolt V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Primeval Beak
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, Energy cards can't be attached from your opponent's hand to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mountain Swing
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

data.name: Vaporeon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bubble Pod
attacks.text: Put a Water Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. If you do, attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Torrent
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Eiscue
data.flavorText: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.

attacks.name: Blockface
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.name: Ludicolo
data.flavorText: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.

abilities.name: Enthusiastic Dance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may use this Ability. During this turn, your Basic Pokémon's attacks do 100 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Tympole
data.flavorText: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can't hear its cries of warning.

data.name: Suicune V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fleet-Footed
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Blizzard Rondo
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: When Pikachu meet, they'll touch their tails together and exchange electricity through them as a form of greeting.

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Eldegoss
data.flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

abilities.name: Cotton Lift
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

attacks.name: Blinding Beam
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Luvdisc
data.flavorText: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola's branches.

attacks.name: Synchrodraw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each card in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Applin
data.flavorText: As soon as it's born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.

data.name: Flareon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Detonate
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. This attack does 100 damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Jolteon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Thunder Rumble
attacks.text: This attack also does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Emolga
data.flavorText: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That's why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Flaaffy
data.flavorText: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

abilities.name: Dynamotor
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Drowzee
data.flavorText: It puts its prey to sleep and devours their dreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour, so Drowzee doesn't particularly like eating them.

data.name: Espeon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Zen Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon V. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Swoobat
data.flavorText: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon's nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.

attacks.name: Synchro Woofer
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Woobat
data.flavorText: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Golurk V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rewind Beam
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an evolved Pokémon, devolve it by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

data.name: Flabébé
data.flavorText: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it's collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Floette
data.flavorText: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.name: Marshadow
data.flavorText: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.

attacks.name: Rapid Hunt
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Rapid Strike cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Shadow Flicker
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out during your next turn, take 1 more Prize card.

data.name: Medicham V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Yoga Loop
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, take another turn after this one. (Skip Pokémon Checkup.) If 1 of your Pokémon used Yoga Loop during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

attacks.name: Smash Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Hippopotas
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is active during the day and passes the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into the sand.

data.name: Seismitoad
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

attacks.name: Shaky Wave
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

data.name: Palpitoad
data.flavorText: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: It protects itself with its durable skin. It's thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.

attacks.name: Hard Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: If a normally talkative child suddenly stops talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.

data.name: Garbodor V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Trash Stench
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Dialga
data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

attacks.name: Chrono Wind
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon V, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Hydreigon
data.flavorText: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won't slow until their target goes down.

attacks.name: Dragon Counter
attacks.text: This attack does 100 more damage for each Prize card your opponent took during their last turn.

data.name: Regidrago
data.flavorText: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Energy
attacks.text: This attack does 20 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Vigoroth
data.flavorText: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Ursaring
data.flavorText: Although it has a large body, it is quite skilled at climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.

data.name: Herdier
data.flavorText: It has been living with people for so long that portrayals of it can be found on the walls of caves from long, long ago.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Lillipup
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it's intelligent, obedient to its Trainer's commands, and easy to raise.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Braviary
data.flavorText: Because this Pokémon is hotheaded and belligerent, it's Corviknight that's taken the role of transportation in Galar.

attacks.name: Valiant Talons
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Stoutland
data.flavorText: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage.

You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

data.name: Hoppip
data.flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

attacks.name: Continuous Spin
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Max Leaf
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Lilligant
data.flavorText: It's well liked by other Pokémon because of its beauty. The flower on its head needs constant care, or it will soon wither and rot.

attacks.name: Dizzying Flower
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Crustle
data.flavorText: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They're mighty enough to crack Rhyperior's carapace.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Trevenant VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Missing in the Forest
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage for each Supporter card in your opponent's discard pile.

data.name: Sharpedo
data.flavorText: It drinks in seawater and jets it from its rear to propel itself. It's very sensitive to the scent of blood.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jet Bite
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: With its sturdy jaws and fangs, it can easily chomp wooden boats to splinters. It fights with Basculin over food.

data.name: Dracozolt VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spark Trap
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 12 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frozen Awakening
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Heavy Snow
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: It has been found that its brain cells are 10 times more active when Psyduck is experiencing a headache.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: Its body is 99% water. The remaining 1% contains the organ that makes its poison.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.

attacks.name: Big Sparking
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Entei
data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

attacks.name: Angry Fang
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Single Strike Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Gyarados VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

data.name: Avalugg
data.flavorText: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon's body returns to a pristine state overnight.

attacks.name: Frost Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Ampharos
data.flavorText: Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electron Crush
attacks.text: You may discard 3 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Gossifleur
data.flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Espeon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solar Revelation
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks from your opponent's Pokémon done to all of your Pokémon that have Energy attached.(Existing effects are not removed. Damage is not an effect.)

attacks.name: Max Mindstorm
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Sylveon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Precious Touch
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, heal 120 damage from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Harmony
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

data.name: Pumpkaboo
data.flavorText: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.

abilities.name: Pumpkin Pit
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Stadium in play.

data.name: Gourgeist
data.flavorText: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.

attacks.name: Pandemonium
attacks.text: Reveal the top 6 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each Psychic Pokémon you find there. Then, shuffle those Pokémon back into your deck and discard the other cards.

data.name: Ribombee
data.flavorText: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.

attacks.name: Tricky Steps
attacks.text: You may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hippowdon
data.flavorText: When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out the quantities of sand it has swallowed and whips up a sandstorm.

attacks.name: Sand Press
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Zapdos
data.flavorText: One kick from its powerful legs will pulverize a dump truck. Supposedly, this Pokémon runs through the mountains at over 180 mph.

abilities.name: Strong Legs Charge
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may attach up to 2 Fighting Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zapper Kick
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Roggenrola
data.flavorText: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.

data.name: Boldore
data.flavorText: It relies on sound in order to monitor what's in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it's facing.

attacks.name: Protect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Lycanroc V

attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dark Signal

data.name: Shiftry
data.flavorText: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

attacks.name: Shiftadieu
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any damage counters on it, put it and all attached cards into your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Nipping Cyclone
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Garbodor VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Rubbish Collecting
abilities.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tools attached to it. If it loses this Ability, discard Pokémon Tools from it until only 1 remains.

attacks.name: G-Max Malodor
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Altaria
data.flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

abilities.name: Tempting Tune
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

data.name: Thievul
data.flavorText: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

abilities.name: Fumbling Hands
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may have each player shuffle their hand and put it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, each player draws 4 cards.

data.name: Shelgon
data.flavorText: Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut up in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will be able to fly.

attacks.name: Hard Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Kyurem
data.flavorText: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

attacks.name: Extreme Freeze
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Zygarde
data.flavorText: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

attacks.name: Judgment Surge
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Flapple
data.flavorText: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.

attacks.name: Acidic Mucus

attacks.name: Fighting Tackle
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Appletun
data.flavorText: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.

attacks.name: Thick Mucus
attacks.text: This attack does 70 damage for each Special Energy card attached to your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Tackle
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Smack 'n' Slack
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Nitro Dive

data.name: Froslass
data.flavorText: It spits out cold air of nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.

abilities.name: Frost Over
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crystal Breath
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Skiploom
data.flavorText: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.

abilities.name: Solar Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Seedot
data.flavorText: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

data.name: Wishiwashi
data.flavorText: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.

abilities.name: Group Power
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has 3 or more Water Energy attached, it gets +150 HP.

attacks.name: Schooling Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each basic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Cryogonal
data.flavorText: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Element Chain
attacks.text: Look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Gyarados V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Get Angry
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: A professional swimmer, it can continue swimming for two days straight by waving its long tail skillfully.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: It communicates with others of its kind by lighting up the red orbs on its head. When the orbs are blinking, it's a warning sign.

attacks.name: Poisonous Prison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Pyroar
data.flavorText: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn't use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.

attacks.name: Rip Claw
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Mareep
data.flavorText: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You'll want to pet it because it's cute, but if you use your bare hand, you'll get a painful shock.

data.name: Milotic
data.flavorText: It's said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you're feeling.

abilities.name: Dew Guard
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to you or your hand.

attacks.name: Double Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Surging Flames
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each basic Energy card in your discard pile. Then, shuffle those Energy cards into your deck.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Lombre
data.flavorText: It lives at the water's edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Hypno
data.flavorText: There are some Hypno that assist doctors with patients who can't sleep at night in hospitals.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Wake-Up Slap
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 90 more damage. Then, that Pokémon recovers from all Special Conditions.

data.name: Wobbuffet
data.flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

attacks.name: Mirror Pain
attacks.text: Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon equal to the number of damage counters on 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Florges
data.flavorText: Its life can span several hundred years. It's said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

abilities.name: Rapid Strike Connection
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move an Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your Rapid Strike Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wonder Shine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

data.name: Cutiefly
data.flavorText: An opponent's aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent's next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

data.name: Gigalith
data.flavorText: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 50 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pressure Shot

data.name: Scrafty
data.flavorText: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.

attacks.name: Shakedown
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Zoroark
data.flavorText: If it thinks humans are going to discover its den, Zoroark shows them visions that make them wander around in the woods.

abilities.name: Phantom Transformation
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may choose a Stage 1 Pokémon, except any Zoroark, from your discard pile. If you do, discard this Pokémon and all attached cards, and put the chosen Pokémon in its place.

data.name: Drampa
data.flavorText: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it's angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

attacks.name: Berserk
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Vee-Search
